import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor, GradientBoostingRegressor
from sklearn.linear_model import Ridge, Lasso
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, StandardScaler
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
import xgboost as xgb
import lightgbm as lgb
from sklearn.model_selection import GridSearchCV
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Drop Id column
train = train.drop('Id', axis=1)
test = test.drop('Id', axis=1)

# Fill missing values with median/mean or mode
numerical_columns = train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
categorical_columns = train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Fill numerical missing values with median
train[numerical_columns] = train[numerical_columns].fillna(train[numerical_columns].median(numeric_only=True))
test[numerical_columns] = test[numerical_columns].fillna(test[numerical_columns].median(numeric_only=True))

# Fill categorical missing values with mode
for col in categorical_columns:
    train[col] = train[col].fillna(train[col].mode()[0] if not train[col].mode().empty else 'Unknown')
    test[col] = test[col].fillna(test[col].mode()[0] if not test[col].mode().empty else 'Unknown')

# Encode categorical variables using OneHotEncoder
categorical_columns = [col for col in categorical_columns if col != target]
encoder = OneHotEncoder(drop='first', handle_unknown='ignore')
categorical_encoded = encoder.fit_transform(train[categorical_columns]).toarray()
categorical_encoded_df = pd.DataFrame(categorical_encoded, columns=encoder.get_feature_names_out(categorical_columns))

# Combine with nu

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.linear_model import Ridge
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
import xgboost as xgb
import lightgbm as lgb

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Drop Id column
train = train.drop('Id', axis=1)
test = test.drop('Id', axis=1)

# Fill missing values
numerical_columns = train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
categorical_columns = train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Fill numerical with median
train[numerical_columns] = train[numerical_columns].fillna(train[numerical_columns].median(numeric_only=True))
test[numerical_columns] = test[numerical_columns].fillna(test[numerical_columns].median(numeric_only=True))

# Fill categorical with mode
for col in categorical_columns:
    train[col] = train[col].fillna(train[col].mode()[0] if not train[col].mode().empty else 'Unknown')
    test[col] = test[col].fillna(test[col].mode()[0] if not test[col].mode().empty else 'Unknown')

# Encode categorical variables
categorical_columns = [col for col in categorical_columns if col != target]
encoder = OneHotEncoder(drop='first', handle_unknown='ignore')
cat_train = encoder.fit_transform(train[categorical_columns]).toarray()
cat_test = encoder.transform(test[categorical_columns]).toarray()

# Combine features
X_train = pd.concat([train[numerical_columns], pd.DataFrame(cat_train, columns=encoder.get_feature_names_out(categorical_columns))], axis=1)
X_test = pd.concat([test[numerical_columns], pd.DataFrame(cat_test, columns=encoder.get_feature_names_out(categorical_columns))], axis=1)

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Drop Id column
train = train.drop('Id', axis=1)
test = test.drop('Id', axis=1)

# Fill missing values
numerical_columns = train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
categorical_columns = train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Fill numerical with median
train[numerical_columns] = train[numerical_columns].fillna(train[numerical_columns].median(numeric_only=True))
test[numerical_columns] = test[numerical_columns].fillna(test[numerical_columns].median(numeric_only=True))

# Fill categorical with mode
for col in categorical_columns:
    train[col] = train[col].fillna(train[col].mode()[0] if not train[col].mode().empty else 'Unknown')
    test[col] = test[col].fillna(test[col].mode()[0] if not test[col].mode().empty else 'Unknown')

# Create feature matrix
X_train = train.copy()
X_test = test.copy()

# Encode categorical variables using OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
categorical_columns = [col for col in categorical_columns if col != target]
encoder = OneHotEncoder(drop='first', handle_unknown='ignore')
cat_train = encoder.fit_transform(X_train[categorical_columns]).toarray()
cat_test = encoder.transform(X_test[categorical_columns]).toarray()

# Combine with numerical features
X_train_encoded = pd.concat([X_train[numerical_columns], pd.DataFrame(cat_train, columns=encoder.get_feature_names_out(categorical_columns))], axis=1)
X_test_encoded = pd.concat([X_test[numerical_columns], pd.DataFrame(cat_test, columns=encoder.get_feature_names_out(categorical_columns))], axis=1)

# Target
y_train = train[target]

# Train model
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=200, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train_encoded, y_train)

# Predict on test set
test_predic
